channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Searching for peace at work? Try these easy mini-meditations
item.description: The idea of meditating can be intimidating. Beginners may imagine sitting uncomfortably in silence while breathing deeply and scrubbing all thoughts f...

item.title: Scientists say eating a plant-based diet could save 15 million deaths and save the environment
item.description: The first EAT-Lancet report proposed a “planetary health diet” centered on grains, fruits, vegetables, nuts and legumes.

item.title: ‘We are going to destroy jobs faster than we can replace them’: The CEO whose 80% stock plunge personified the dotcom bubble on AI’s impact
item.description: "There are a lot of parallels but there are also some spectacular differences," says former Cisco CEO John Chambers, adding that AI is moving at 5x th...

item.title: Lawsuit: Tesla design trapped a college student inside as it burst into flames
item.description: Krysta Tsukahara was in the back of a Cybertruck when the driver who was drunk and had taken drugs smashed into a tree, according to the suit.

item.title: Apple removes ICEBlock app after pressure from Trump officials
item.description: Apple has taken down an app that uses crowdsourcing to flag sightings of U.S. immigration agents after coming under pressure from the Trump administra...

item.title: Tesla Is Facing a Lawsuit Over a Potential Design Flaw and Fatal Crash
item.description: The lawsuit alleges that a college student killed in a Tesla crash was trapped in a burning Cybertruck because of an issue with the doors.

item.title: 2 Amazon Delivery Drones Crashed Into a Crane, and Now the FAA and NTSB Are Involved
item.description: Drone incidents like Amazon’s remain rare, and experts are researching ways to prevent collisions.

item.title: Are Your Employees Using AI to Create Fake Expense Receipts?
item.description: Growing evidence indicates employees are using AI apps to generate authentic-looking fake bills to submit as expenses.

item.title: Snapchat is now charging for storage, drawing ire over subscription creep. Here’s what to do if you don’t want to pay
item.description: Snapchat rankled some of its most loyal (and heavy) users when it announced last week it will begin charging for storage plans for Memories, its versi...

item.title: Meet the only campus protester still locked up by Trump, a 32-year-old Palestinian who grew up in the West Bank with aunts and uncles in Gaza
item.description: “Most days I feel helpless,” says Leqaa Kordia, the New Jersey resident who has been jailed since March in a Texas immigration detention center.

item.title: America’s landlords settle claim they used rent-setting algorithms to gouge consumers nationwide for $141 million
item.description: Greystar, the nation's largest landlord, would pay $50 million under the proposed settlement agreement, with 25 others also settling.

item.title: Why Some Companies Adopting AI May Be Running Before They Can Walk
item.description: If you’re rolling out AI to your workers and expecting them to use it, training them first is critical.

item.title: Former Cisco CEO talks about AI’s parallels to the internet, job market shifts, and China
item.description: Former Cisco Systems CEO John Chambers learned all about technology’s volatile highs and lows as a veteran of the internet’s early boom days during th...

item.title: How Brands Are Cashing In on Taylor Swift’s ‘The Life of a Showgirl’ Hype
item.description: Businesses are tapping into the singer’s latest album to win over the Swiftie fandom.

item.title: Taylor Swift’s ‘Life of a Showgirl’ could be the lifeline Target desperately needs
